page.title: 06EDUCATION - l895 - l945
page.content:
The{Cubert Board School}first opened on lst July, l895 with 65 pupils on roll. The staff consisted of the principal master and an assistant mistress for infants and sewing.
The building consisted of a main room and a smaller room. The log book notes examples of the formal object lessons given to the whole school which then ranged from 5 - l5.
Great importance was made of attend- ance and extra days holiday were given for high percentages. The registers were inspected regularly. The school was closed on occasions when attendance fell below 50%. Children were often absent for local feasts, such as tea treats, to help on the farm and for national celebrations.
